meanings.definition: To smear or blur with a substance.
meanings.sent1: She accidentally started smudging the ink on her paper while erasing a mistake.
meanings.sent2: The artist was careful not to smudge the paint on the canvas.
meanings.sent3: While baking, she ended up smudging flour all over the kitchen counter.
meanings.sent4: The raindrops on the window created a smudging effect on the glass.
meanings.sent5: The child's fingerprints were smudging the mirror every time he touched it.

meanings.definition: To cleanse or purify by burning herbs or incense.
meanings.sent1: During the ceremony, they were smudging the room with sage to remove negative energy.
meanings.sent2: The shaman explained the tradition of smudging to the curious visitors.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly said she would start smudging the house with incense to keep away the imaginary monsters.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of the smudging herbs filled the air with a sense of calm.
meanings.sent5: The practice of smudging has been passed down through generations in their family.

meanings.definition: A technique used in art to create shading or blending.
meanings.sent1: The artist used smudging to add depth to the portrait.
meanings.sent2: Students were taught the basics of smudging in their art class.
meanings.sent3: The smudging tool helped the painter achieve a realistic look in the landscape.
meanings.sent4: Her use of smudging in the drawing gave it a soft and dreamy appearance.
meanings.sent5: The art teacher demonstrated the art of smudging to the eager students.
